basics.name: Y. Isabel Liu
basics.label: PhD Applicant in Robotics
basics.summary: Computer Science undergraduate at Princeton University researching task and motion planning, robot learning, and dexterous manipulation. Applying to PhD programs in Robotics for Fall 2026.

work.name: Princeton PRPL Lab
work.summary: Enhancing belief-space planning with LLM-guided exploration in partially observable task and motion planning. Advisor: Professor Tom Silver.
highlights: Develop LLM-based policy generation for belief-space TAMP using few-shot learning
Explore closed-loop policy synthesis leveraging common-sense reasoning

work.name: Stanford IPRL Lab
work.summary: Dexterous manipulation with touch sensing on high-precision peg assembly and disassembly. Advisor: Professor Jeannette Bohg.
highlights: Augment VLA models with residual policy using force-torque and tactile feedback
Develop slow-fast multimodal networks for real-time control

work.name: Princeton PRPL Lab
work.summary: Automated learning of robot physical improvisations under TAMP framework. Advisors: Professor Tom Silver and Professor Benjamin Eysenbach.
highlights: Designed SLAP algorithm to improve TAMP through model-free learning of physical improvisations
Conducted experiments over PyBullet and 2D TAMP environments

work.name: Princeton Hazan Lab
work.summary: Computational optimizations for hybrid STU-Attention models. Advisor: Professor Elad Hazan.
highlights: Proposed Flash STU architecture achieving SOTA in language modeling
Optimized tensordot approximation reducing complexity by factor of k

volunteer.summary: Lead student organization for AI research and education at Princeton.
highlights: Organize annual AI Tiger Trek to San Francisco connecting students with AI researchers and startups
Lead weekly presentations and biweekly AI lunches with faculty

volunteer.summary: Teaching assistant for Computer Science courses.
highlights: Hold office hours for 'Algorithms and Data Structures' and 'Introduction to Programming Systems'

volunteer.summary: Provide career advising to fellow students.
highlights: Conducted one-on-one advising on resumes and internship search

awards.title: Exemplary Independent Work Award
awards.summary: Awarded to 5 students by the Princeton Computer Science Department for exceptional independent research work.
